page.title: 12W.H.LEVER
page.content: One of the major influences on the south-eastern corner of the block was the contribution of the soap magnate W.H.Lever. Having made his fortune at Port Sunlight, this Boltonian returned to the scene of his courtship at Rivington, selecting a site above Horwich as the ideal retreat where he built a bungalow with extensive gardens from 1900. The house itself is properly the subject of another block, but a large area of the gardens centred around a Japanese lagoon and terrace are within our scope. Even more significantly, Lever donated a large area of his estate as a park for the people of Bolton. Like many Victorians he was a stern believer in self-help and profit but was also a remarkable philanthropist.
